main event: Crew aboard USS Comstock observed three bright objects of differing shapes and sizes ascend almost vertically until they disappeared from sight.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be self-luminous and unrelated to any known aircraft.
The observers reported that the objects' exhaust trail disappeared and reappeared, indicating a possible second ignition.
The observers stated that the objects were in horizontal flight before suddenly stopping and disappearing from view.
The sighting occurred in Sasebo, Japan, with the objects observed at about 25 degrees elevation and an azimuth of 175 degrees.
The sighting lasted for approximately 5 minutes.
sighted object: three bright objects of differing shapes and sizes
